Class ValueCollectionEmptyTests

java.lang.Object
myTest.ValueCollectionEmptyTests
public class ValueCollectionEmptyTests extends Object
This test case tests the ValueCollection class instances linked to an empty map. Every method of the ValueCollection class is tested to ensure the class implementation serves correctly as a view for empty maps. For each method tests are created to ensure correct behavior in normal and edge cases, including correct throwing of exceptions and correct return values and side effects on the underlying map.
See Also:
  • MapAdapter
  • MapAdapter.ValueCollection
Design
This test case aims to verify the correct behavior of empty values instances to ensure it correctly serves as a collection view for empty maps and implements correctly the HCollection interface.
Libraries
JUnit 4.13, Hamcrest 1.3

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment by initializing an empty MapAdapter through the MapAdapter's default constructor and creating an ValueCollection instance obtaining its value collection view.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Cleans up the test environment by setting the map and values references to null, allowing for garbage collection.

    • testSize

      public void testSize()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method is called on the collection view created by the setUp() method. Since the linked map is empty, the method should return 0.
      Preconditions
      The map is correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.

    • testIsEmpty

      public void testIsEmpty()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.isEmpty() method returns true for an empty map.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.isEmpty() method returns true for an empty map.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.isEmpty() method is called on the collection view created by the setUp() method. Since the linked map is empty, the method should return true.
      Preconditions
      The map is correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.isEmpty() method returns true for an empty map.

    • testContainsNull

      public void testContainsNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument as not supported by the underlying map implementation.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method is called with null as an argument on the value collection. Since the underlying map does not support null keys, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsNotContainedElement

      public void testContainsNotContainedElement()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.
      Description
      To create a non-contained element, a new MapAdapter instance is created, and an entry is added to it. The value is then extracted using the value collection view of the new map. The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method is called with this value on the original value collection. Since the original map is empty, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated. Another MapAdapter instance is created with an entry and the value is then extracted from its value collection.
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.

    • testIteratorNotNull

      public void testIteratorNotNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty value collection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty value collection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.iterator() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, the method should return a non-null iterator that iterates over no elements.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty value collection.

      public void testToArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns a non-null array for an empty value collection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns a non-null array for an empty value collection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, the method should return a non-null array with a length of 0.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns a non-null array for an empty value collection.

    • testToArrayNullArray

      public void testToArrayNullArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method is called with null as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the method does not support null arrays, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testToArrayWithBiggerArray

      public void testToArrayWithBiggerArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns an empty array when an empty array is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns an empty array when an bigger empty array is passed as an argument.
      Description
      A new empty array of size 5 is created. Then the array is populated with flags to ensure that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method does not overwrite the elements of the array. The format for the flags is "flag-i" where i is the index of the element. The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method is then called with this array as an argument. Since the value collection is empty, the method should return the bigger passed array without overwriting its elements.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns the same array passed as argument with the first element set to null as a terminator and the remaining elements unchanged.

    • testAdd

      public void testAdd()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty value collection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty value collection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method is called with a string as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is a view of an empty map, the method should throw an UnsupportedOperationException as adding elements to a value collection is not allowed.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty value collection.

    • testRemoveNull

      public void testRemoveNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method is called with null as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the method does not support null values, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testRemoveNonContained

      public void testRemoveNonContained()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument since it has no effect on the value collection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method is called with a string that is not contained in the value collection on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, the method should return false, indicating that the element was not contained in the value collection. Since the value collection is backed by the map, the map should remain empty after the operation.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsAllNull

      public void testContainsAllNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with null as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the method does not accept null collections, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsAllSameElements

      public void testContainsAllSameElements()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when an empty collection is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when an empty collection is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with an empty collection on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, it should contain all elements of the empty collection, and the method should return true.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when an empty collection is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsAllMoreElements

      public void testContainsAllMoreElements()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with a collection (for this test another MapAdapter's ValueCollection containing two entries: "key1"->"value1" and "key2"->"value2") that contains more elements than the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, it should not contain all elements of the collection, and the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.

    • testAddAll

      public void testAddAll()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an HCollection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an HCollection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method is called with another MapAdapter's value collection on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the method is not supported by the value collection view it should throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty value collection.

      Preconditions

      Postconditions

      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.retainAll(HCollection) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testClear

      public void testClear()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the value collection and leaves the underlying map empty.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the value collection and leaves the underlying map empty.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is backed by the underlying map, clearing the value collection should also clear the map.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the value collection and leaves the underlying map empty.

    • testEqualsSameSet

      public void testEqualsSameSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns true when an value collection with the same entries is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns true when an value collection with the same entries is passed as an argument.
      Description
      A new empty MapAdapter instance is created, and its value collection is obtained. The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method the new one. Since it contains the same entries (none), the method should return true.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns true when an value collection with the same entries is passed as an argument.

    • testEqualsDifferentSet

      public void testEqualsDifferentSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when an value collection with different entries is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when an value collection with different entries is passed as an argument.
      Description
      A new MapAdapter instance is created with an entry ("key", "value"). Its value collection is obtained, and the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method and the new one. Since it contains different entries, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when an value collection with different entries is passed as an argument.

    • testEqualsNotACollection

      public void testEqualsNotACollection()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an ValueCollection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an ValueCollection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method is called with a String as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the argument is not an ValueCollection, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an ValueCollection.

    • testEqualsSet

      public void testEqualsSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is an HSet.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is an HSet, as collections and sets are not compatible for equality.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method is called with an MapAdapter.KeySet as an argument on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the argument is a set, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated.
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty.
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is an HSet.

    • testHashCode

      public void testHashCode()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns 0 for an empty value collection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns 0 for an empty value collection since it has no entries.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method. Since the value collection is empty, the method should return 0.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns 0 for an empty value collection.

    • testHashCodeDifferentSets

      public void testHashCodeDifferentSets()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different value collections.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different value collections when one is empty and the other contains elements.
      Description
      A new MapAdapter instance is created with an entry ("key", "value"). Its value collection is obtained, and the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method and the new one. Since the value collections are different (one empty, one with elements), the method should return different hash codes.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different value collections.

    • testHashCodeSameSet

      public void testHashCodeSameSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same value collection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same value collection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method and another instance of the same value collection. Since both instances are views of the same empty map, the method should return the same hash code.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same value collection.

    • testEqualsImpliesHashCode

      public void testEqualsImpliesHashCode()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method implies that the hash codes of the value collections are equal.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that if two value collections are equal, their hash codes should also be equal.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method is called on the value collection created by the setUp() method with itself as an argument. Since it is the same value collection, the method should return true. The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is then called on both value collections, and their hash codes should be equal.
      Preconditions
      The map and the value collection are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is still empty
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.ValueCollection.equals(Object) method implies that the hash codes of the value collections are equal.
